pull.title: test: Use wait_until to ensure ping goes out

issue.title: scripted-diff: Rename key size consts to be relative to their class
issue.body: ~~And introduce CPubKeySig to host code relative to key sigs.~~

events.body: Could we instead get rid of the time.sleep with an arbitrary argument? That is just terrible practice. If it is necessary to wait on some predicate, you might use the wait_until helper function.
Sounds good to me, hadn't seen `wait_until`

test: Use wait_until to ensure ping goes out

Intermittent failure evident here:
https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/344021180

events.message:
test: Use wait_until to ensure ping goes out

Intermittent failure evident here:
https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/344021180

rename.from: test: Extend wait time by .1 seconds to ensure ping goes out
rename.to: test: Use wait_until to ensure ping goes out

events.body: Switched to using `wait_until` here. There are a few other uses of time.sleep for this sort of thing. I'll switch them over in another PR.

issue.title: Prefer wait_until over polling with time.sleep
issue.body:
This is prompted by and builds on #12545, a nice cleanup / consolidation of patterns.

In cases where the exception message was meaningful, I tried to represent it as well in a comment.

I expect #12545 will go in first, but I'm happy to squash them if that's preferred.

events.body:
Tested 0eb84f30d80847b7392ad42b2d916eaf5923a63c ACK.

I also saw this issue last week, thanks for fix.
